titleStmt.title: C. C. Collier et al. to unknown
CWG7149

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: The undersigned Jurors who tried the Case of the Commonwealth vs Wyatt Ford for permitting Gaming in a House of which he had the control on the 12th day of Oct 1865 found Said Ford Guilty and fixed his fine at $200 The evidence conduced to Show that he was a farmer and On One Occasion a few friends were at his house and played a Game More for amusement than the money at which a small amount was bet.
We respectfully ask his Excellency the Governor of Ky. to remit said fine Except the Sixty dollars going to the Commonwlths' Attorney

C C Collier
David Mils
Wm A. Jett
O M Grimes
Thos H Flournoy
E. Rudolph
W Bonds
S P Carrico
A. G. Lee
F. S. Robinson
S. F. Murrell
S. S. Wilson
I Know the within named jurymen and say unhesitatingly they are good law abiding citizens and respectfully urge their request

I heard the trial in this case and am fully satisfied the Gov ought to interpose as the evidence showed that the parites all regarded the game played as a joke and the money put up was surrendered to each player who had lost on the game I had no intrest in the trial.
Octo 13 1865

McCracken Cir Ct
vs
Wyatt Ford
$200,
Gaming
Remitted 18th Nov /65
